titleStmt.title: A declaration of His Most Sacred Majesty, King James II. To all his loving subjects in the Kingdom of England.
titleStmt.author: James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

notesStmt.note: States that his aim is to give equal rights to all, whether Protestant or Roman Catholic. Offers pardon to those returning to his allegiance upon his re-entry into England.
At end of text: Given at our court, in Dublin-Castle, the eighth of May, 1689. in the fifth year of our reign.
Arms 110a; Steele notation: Enemies Ground 2) secured desire.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
